item.title: Market News: Trump to Launch Bitcoin Reserve Plan "Soon"
item.description: August 1st. According to market reports, Bo Hines, who is the Executive Director of Trump's Digital Asset Advisory Committee, declared that Trump will "in the near future" launch a Bitcoin reserve plan. (Golden Ten)

item.title: H100 Group Increases Holding Again by 17.47 BTC, Total Holding Reaches 702.6 BTC
item.description: On August 1st, based on the monitoring of @btcNLNico, a Swedish-listed company announced the acquisition of an additional 17.47 BTC, bringing its total holdings to 702.6 BTC.

item.title: Coinbase Stock Price Drops 12%, Marks Largest Intraday Decline Since April
item.description: On August 1st, based on the market data from Rockflow, the stock price of Coinbase (COIN.O) dropped by 12% and is now trading at $331, which marks the largest intraday decline since April.

item.title: 「Fed's Megaphone」: Slowing Job Market to Test Fed's Unyielding Rate Policy
item.description: August 1st. In a message from "the Fed Whisperer," Nick Timiraos, it was indicated that the recent three-month slowdown in employment might have created an opportunity for Fed officials to consider a rate cut at their next meeting in September. At the least, this has highlighted the difficult balancing act they are facing amid economic slowdown and rising inflationary pressures.Given that the labor market had been demonstrating robust job growth, Fed officials had been at ease this year in maintaining the stability of interest rates. However, significant downward adjustments to the May and June employment data have changed that situation. Fed officials had previously stated that they were less concerned about overall job growth as it had slowed in tandem with the deceleration in labor force growth.When the labor supply shrinks, even if job growth decelerates, the unemployment rate can still remain stable or even decrease. Nevertheless, Fed Chair Powell noted this week that the stab

item.title: Bitcoin Continues to Surge After Non-Farm Payrolls Announcement, Breaking Above $116,000
item.description: On August 1st, according to HTX market data, Bitcoin continued to rise following the release of US non-farm payrolls data and broke through $116,000. It is currently priced at $116,005, with a 24-hour decline narrowed to 2.02%.

item.title: The trader is fully pricing in the scenario of two more Fed rate cuts before the end of the year.
item.description: On August 1st, traders have fully factored in the situation where the Fed will cut interest rates twice before the end of the year. (Xinhua)

item.title: Michael Saylor: Strategy Could Involve Buying Up to 1.5 Million Bitcoin
item.description: On August 1st, Michael Saylor declared during a CNBC interview that Strategy might acquire up to 1.5 million bitcoins. This would result in holding more than 7.14% of the entire Bitcoin supply.As of the publicly available data as of this Monday, Strategy holds a combined total of 628,791 bitcoins, and the overall average holding price is $73,277.

item.title: Futures Market Implication: Traders believe there is a 75% chance that the Fed will cut interest rates by 25 basis points at the September meeting.
item.description: On August 1st, the implications in the futures market suggest that traders hold the view that there is a 75% probability of a 25-basis-point rate cut by the Federal Reserve at the September meeting. This probability has increased from 45% prior to the release of the employment report. (FXStreet)

item.title: Solana's futures trading volume and open interest on CME hit all-time highs in July.
item.description: On August 1st, based on The Block's data dashboard, it was observed that Solana (SOL) experienced a notable month-on-month growth in trading volume and open interest within CME's futures market during July. Both metrics reached new highs since the product's launch.Specifically, the total trading volume of SOL futures on CME saw a significant increase, rising from $2.3 billion in June to $8.1 billion in July, representing a 252% month-on-month growth. At the same time, the average monthly open interest also witnessed a substantial rise, going from $132.3 million to $400.9 million, which is a 203% month-on-month increase.

item.title: Trader Fully Digests Fed's October Rate Cut
item.description: On August 1st, traders have completely digested the Fed's scenario of an interest rate cut in October. (Kten)
